article.headline: Texas-Pan American 91, Texas-Permian Basin 51
article.story: EDINBURG, Texas (AP) -- Brian Burrell scored 16 points and Texas-Pan American shot 56 percent from the field in a 91-51 win over Texas-Permian Basin on Tuesday night. The Broncs (9-8) seized control with a 52-10 run that began in the first half and continued into the second. They closed out the first half with a 30-10 run and opened the second half with 22 straight points. Johnathan Chatman came off the bench to score 12 points for Texas-Pan American and Dexter Shankle added 10. Colin Lien led the Broncs with six rebounds, helping them break a three-game losing streak. Josh Trejo led the Falcons (3-10) with nine points. Matt Zaney added nine rebounds. Texas-Pan American has won all seven of its home games this season.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
